text.content: This blog post is for those of you who have asked me what it was like to launch

text.content: Epic Web is a platform for learning everything you

rich_text.plain_text: Epic Web is a platform for learning everything you

text.content: need to know to build full stack web applications the way I do based on my decade of experience building web apps of all kinds, sizes, and scales. It's terrific, you should check it out.

text.content: I've wanted to do this for a long time. You may recall from the end of 2010s

text.content: @kentcdodds I'm expecting you to announce your online Kent C. Dodds engineering bootcamp.

cells.plain_text: @kentcdodds I'm expecting you to announce your online Kent C. Dodds engineering bootcamp.

text.content: I'm planning on doing this, no joke.

text.content: https://kentcdodds.com/blog/launching-epic-web 2/27 So by the time 2023 started, I had my eyes set on launching Epic

text.content: My wife and I had decided to try for another child and I was committed

rich_text.plain_text: My wife and I had decided to try for another child and I was committed

text.content: to launch Epic Web before the baby came.

rich_text.plain_text: to launch Epic Web before the baby came.

text.content: A big part of getting Epic Web launched was live streaming the process of building the ultimate app we'd be building as part of the workshops. That was

rich_text.plain_text: A big part of getting Epic Web launched was live streaming the process of building the ultimate app we'd be building as part of the workshops. That was

text.content: Rental. You'll find an outrageous number of hours of live stream footage on my

rich_text.plain_text: Rental. You'll find an outrageous number of hours of live stream footage on my

text.content: channel of the process of building that application as well as the

rich_text.plain_text: channel of the process of building that application as well as the

text.content: app which is the application used to facilitate the learning experience for Epic Web.

rich_text.plain_text: app which is the application used to facilitate the learning experience for Epic Web.

text.content: In between snowboarding trips (the 2022/2023 winter season was a record breaking snow season in Utah), I ran workshops based on Rocket Rental. The Workshop App made for a great learning experience even though the size of Rocket Rental was pretty big. This is thanks to the playground, the diffs, and "open file in my editor" features. However, I did find that the size of the app was a bit overwhelming for learners despite this.

rich_text.plain_text: In between snowboarding trips (the 2022/2023 winter season was a record breaking snow season in Utah), I ran workshops based on Rocket Rental. The Workshop App made for a great learning experience even though the size of Rocket Rental was pretty big. This is thanks to the playground, the diffs, and "open file in my editor" features. However, I did find that the size of the app was a bit overwhelming for learners despite this.

text.content: Additionally, I realized that the "target market" of Epic Web was far too broad. This resulted in a couple workshops getting cancelled due to lack of sales (due to marketing problems).

rich_text.plain_text: Additionally, I realized that the "target market" of Epic Web was far too broad. This resulted in a couple workshops getting cancelled due to lack of sales (due to marketing problems).

text.content: I did manage to publish a free

rich_text.plain_text: I did manage to publish a free

text.content: about deploying multi-region applications and distributed SQLite databases all over the world. With that in addition to some articles, it felt great to get some content on the EpicWeb.dev domain and demonstrate I was a serious operation.

rich_text.plain_text: about deploying multi-region applications and distributed SQLite databases all over the world. With that in addition to some articles, it felt great to get some content on the EpicWeb.dev domain and demonstrate I was a serious operation.

text.content: Around this same time, I was invited by the Remix team to run Remix Conf 2023 (the best compliment someone can give you is to ask you to do something again!!). I told them that I wanted to speak this year and they said that was fine so I was trying to decide what my talk would be about.

rich_text.plain_text: Around this same time, I was invited by the Remix team to run Remix Conf 2023 (the best compliment someone can give you is to ask you to do something again!!). I told them that I wanted to speak this year and they said that was fine so I was trying to decide what my talk would be about.

text.content: Around all of this I started feeling kind of lost. I honestly felt lost about what to do with Epic Web. Less than a week before Remix Conf I tweeted this:

rich_text.plain_text: Around all of this I started feeling kind of lost. I honestly felt lost about what to do with Epic Web. Less than a week before Remix Conf I tweeted this:

text.content: replied with a brilliant summary of my problem:

rich_text.plain_text: replied with a brilliant summary of my problem:

text.content: And then, in a stroke of brilliance, Matt said:

rich_text.plain_text: And then, in a stroke of brilliance, Matt said:

text.content: If you branded it the 'Kent Stack' and leaned in to it being _your_ method for building web apps, I could see people really going for that.

cells.plain_text: If you branded it the 'Kent Stack' and leaned in to it being _your_ method for building web apps, I could see people really going for that.

text.content: 'We want to use the Kent Stack'

cells.plain_text: 'We want to use the Kent Stack'

text.content: 'We want to learn how to build PESPA'S'

cells.plain_text: 'We want to learn how to build PESPA'S'

text.content: That was the moment I realized that Epic Web wasn't me teaching you everything I know about full stack web development. It's me giving you

rich_text.plain_text: That was the moment I realized that Epic Web wasn't me teaching you everything I know about full stack web development. It's me giving you

text.content: a proven path to building excellent full stack applications.

rich_text.plain_text: a proven path to building excellent full stack applications.

text.content: The opinions are almost as valuable as the instruction.

rich_text.plain_text: The opinions are almost as valuable as the instruction.

text.content: So I stripped down Rocket Rental to a much simpler note taking application and introduced that to the world as The Epic

rich_text.plain_text: So I stripped down Rocket Rental to a much simpler note taking application and introduced that to the world as The Epic

text.content: the following week. (Yes, it was stressful to do this while also running a conference, but Zero Slope

rich_text.plain_text: the following week. (Yes, it was stressful to do this while also running a conference, but Zero Slope

text.content: makes running a conference much less difficult ).

rich_text.plain_text: makes running a conference much less difficult ).

text.content: It was a smashing success. Now there are a bunch of people building applications based on or referencing the Epic Stack and getting paid to do it. Super gratifying.

rich_text.plain_text: It was a smashing success. Now there are a bunch of people building applications based on or referencing the Epic Stack and getting paid to do it. Super gratifying.

text.content: And it accomplished the original goal of helping me hone my message. Epic Web is where I teach you how to build full stack applications with the Epic Stack. So all the material morphed into us building the Epic Stack together. I came up with great strategies to keep things going (to avoid unnecessary repetition) so by the end of the series of workshops, you've built all the most important pieces of the Epic Stack which you can then use to build whatever you'd like.

rich_text.plain_text: And it accomplished the original goal of helping me hone my message. Epic Web is where I teach you how to build full stack applications with the Epic Stack. So all the material morphed into us building the Epic Stack together. I came up with great strategies to keep things going (to avoid unnecessary repetition) so by the end of the series of workshops, you've built all the most important pieces of the Epic Stack which you can then use to build whatever you'd like.

text.content: By this time, my wife and I had a due date for our 5th child. This gave me a deadline for the launch of Epic Web. I had a lot of workshops to prepare. And I needed to deliver those workshops to real people before I got them recorded and made available as self-paced workshops.

rich_text.plain_text: By this time, my wife and I had a due date for our 5th child. This gave me a deadline for the launch of Epic Web. I had a lot of workshops to prepare. And I needed to deliver those workshops to real people before I got them recorded and made available as self-paced workshops.

text.content: So I put together a schedule. I needed to get all the workshops delivered to real people by mid-August so I could spend the second half of August and first half of September recording the videos so they could be edited, transcribed, and published by October. At the time I was planning this, it was mid-May. I figured I had plenty of time.

rich_text.plain_text: So I put together a schedule. I needed to get all the workshops delivered to real people by mid-August so I could spend the second half of August and first half of September recording the videos so they could be edited, transcribed, and published by October. At the time I was planning this, it was mid-May. I figured I had plenty of time.

text.content: I already had a two day workshop on "Full Stack Foundations" and one day on "Testing Web Apps" based on Rocket Rental. I was planning on adding workshops on Web Forms, Data Modeling, and Web Authentication. I figured updating the existing workshops and creating the new workshops wouldn't be an enormous task because I knew the end state was just the Epic Stack so there weren't really unknowns.

rich_text.plain_text: I already had a two day workshop on "Full Stack Foundations" and one day on "Testing Web Apps" based on Rocket Rental. I was planning on adding workshops on Web Forms, Data Modeling, and Web Authentication. I figured updating the existing workshops and creating the new workshops wouldn't be an enormous task because I knew the end state was just the Epic Stack so there weren't really unknowns.

text.content: That all was true. There really weren't many unknowns, most of the Epic Stack remained the same through the workshop development. And I'm quite fast at putting workshops together with the experience I've had over the years. And the workshop app made me even more productive at putting workshops together.

rich_text.plain_text: That all was true. There really weren't many unknowns, most of the Epic Stack remained the same through the workshop development. And I'm quite fast at putting workshops together with the experience I've had over the years. And the workshop app made me even more productive at putting workshops together.

text.content: But still. I vastly underestimated the amount of work this would take...

rich_text.plain_text: But still. I vastly underestimated the amount of work this would take...

text.content: So I get to mid-July and I'm still not even finished getting the foundations workshop completed. But I didn't really have much choice (and I still naively felt like I should be able to manage this without trouble ). So I open up tickets for "The Full Stack Workshop Series (Vol 1) ." It involved 8 days worth of workshops. Two workshops a week for 4 weeks straight.

rich_text.plain_text: So I get to mid-July and I'm still not even finished getting the foundations workshop completed. But I didn't really have much choice (and I still naively felt like I should be able to manage this without trouble ). So I open up tickets for "The Full Stack Workshop Series (Vol 1) ." It involved 8 days worth of workshops. Two workshops a week for 4 weeks straight.

text.content: We sold out 30 seats very quickly. So I decided to open it up to 30 more and those sold out before the early bird time was finished.

rich_text.plain_text: We sold out 30 seats very quickly. So I decided to open it up to 30 more and those sold out before the early bird time was finished.

text.content: This was extremely encouraging! So I got back to work, but started to feel a little nervous about the time. Now that I had people's money, I knew I really had to deliver the best workshop experience possible.

rich_text.plain_text: This was extremely encouraging! So I got back to work, but started to feel a little nervous about the time. Now that I had people's money, I knew I really had to deliver the best workshop experience possible.

text.content: I managed to finish the first two days worth of workshops and the brand new forms workshop the week before the series was scheduled. So I was able to start working on the data workshop.

rich_text.plain_text: I managed to finish the first two days worth of workshops and the brand new forms workshop the week before the series was scheduled. So I was able to start working on the data workshop.

text.content: So, imagine this... I have a brand new workshop not yet created that I'm scheduled to deliver in a week and two days. And on top of that, three of those days will be spent delivering other workshops. Oh, and I have more workshops to create and deliver after that.

rich_text.plain_text: So, imagine this... I have a brand new workshop not yet created that I'm scheduled to deliver in a week and two days. And on top of that, three of those days will be spent delivering other workshops. Oh, and I have more workshops to create and deliver after that.

text.content: It was at this point I realized how much trouble I was in and started pulling 16-18 hour days, 6 days a week, for 5 weeks. This was the most stressful work of my life. This is a good visual of how I felt during this time:

rich_text.plain_text: It was at this point I realized how much trouble I was in and started pulling 16-18 hour days, 6 days a week, for 5 weeks. This was the most stressful work of my life. This is a good visual of how I felt during this time:

text.content: Despite this stress, I did an extremely good job getting good sleep. And my wife was a superhero and took care of everything else. I'm so grateful for her. She put the kids to bed herself, got them ready for school, and did all the housework and cooking. And she was in her second trimester of pregnancy!! She's amazing.

rich_text.plain_text: Despite this stress, I did an extremely good job getting good sleep. And my wife was a superhero and took care of everything else. I'm so grateful for her. She put the kids to bed herself, got them ready for school, and did all the housework and cooking. And she was in her second trimester of pregnancy!! She's amazing.

text.content: Image /page/14/Picture/2 description: This image shows two tweets by Kent C. Dodds (@kentcdodds). The first tweet states, "20 videos done before the kids got home from school. Not as many as I wanted, but it's pretty good considering some last-minute changes I wanted to make. Got these three finished () and the first exercise of the next workshop." The second tweet states, "I didn't get as many videos recorded today (only 8) because I created 3 new exercises as part of the web forms workshop. If I keep doing this, I'll never ship Ship Modern Full-Stack Web Applications." Below the second tweet, there is a section titled "Honeypot Rate Limiting." The image also shows the date and time of the tweets, which is "9:16 PM (UTC) · August 28th, 2023," as well as the number of retweets, likes, and shares.

The post ends with the timestamp "11:43 PM (UTC) · September 14th, 2023" and icons representing 37 comments, a retweet icon, and 522 likes.

text.content: was hard at work getting the videos and the site ready for publication. I also needed to finish up writing some of the instructions for some of the workshops and I had some improvements to make to the workshop app as well.

rich_text.plain_text: was hard at work getting the videos and the site ready for publication. I also needed to finish up writing some of the instructions for some of the workshops and I had some improvements to make to the workshop app as well.

text.content: Only have to write instructions for 5 more exercises. Each one requires about as much written content as you would expect from a full-length tutorial on the topic (almost then length of a chapter in a Harry Potter book).

rich_text.plain_text: Only have to write instructions for 5 more exercises. Each one requires about as much written content as you would expect from a full-length tutorial on the topic (almost then length of a chapter in a Harry Potter book).

text.content: Image /page/18/Picture/2 description: The image shows a tweet that says "nbd. This is 5 of 55 exercises in the whole series". The tweet lists the following topics: OAuth, Connection Errors, Third Party Login, Connection Management, and Redirect Cookie. The tweet was posted on September 20th, 2023 at 4:31 PM (UTC). The tweet has 3 comments, 20 likes, and an unspecified number of retweets.

The tweet has 3 comments, 20 likes, and an unspecified number of retweets.

text.content: It ended up being a LOT of words. As of today, it's 101,407 words worth of instructions. For context, Harry Potter book 1 is 76,944 words. And this only counts the words in the markdown files for the exercises. It doesn't include the words that are inline instructions within the exercise files people work through (which is probably another 30k words).

rich_text.plain_text: It ended up being a LOT of words. As of today, it's 101,407 words worth of instructions. For context, Harry Potter book 1 is 76,944 words. And this only counts the words in the markdown files for the exercises. It doesn't include the words that are inline instructions within the exercise files people work through (which is probably another 30k words).

text.content: And I wrote all of that in about 3 months. I'm pretty freaking proud of that.

rich_text.plain_text: And I wrote all of that in about 3 months. I'm pretty freaking proud of that.

text.content: I also wrapped up the expert interviews and with the team prepared the emails that would go out as part of the launch.

rich_text.plain_text: I also wrapped up the expert interviews and with the team prepared the emails that would go out as part of the launch.

text.content: We decided we wanted to launch on my birthday, October 18th. But we also wanted to start giving people early access. Folks who bought both Epic React and TestingJavaScript Pro were invited to jump on Epic Web

rich_text.plain_text: We decided we wanted to launch on my birthday, October 18th. But we also wanted to start giving people early access. Folks who bought both Epic React and TestingJavaScript Pro were invited to jump on Epic Web

text.content: at a 40% discount a week before the official launch. The next day it was opened to folks who bought either before. Feedback was very positive, so we were ready for launch day.

rich_text.plain_text: at a 40% discount a week before the official launch. The next day it was opened to folks who bought either before. Feedback was very positive, so we were ready for launch day.

text.content: We wanted to make the first 24 hours huge. So we decided to offer a 40% discount + free access to both Epic React and TestingJavaScript.com to anyone who bought Epic Web in the first 24 hours. This is a ridiculous value.

rich_text.plain_text: We wanted to make the first 24 hours huge. So we decided to offer a 40% discount + free access to both Epic React and TestingJavaScript.com to anyone who bought Epic Web in the first 24 hours. This is a ridiculous value.

text.content: Image /page/19/Picture/5 description: This image is a screenshot of a tweet by Kent C. Dodds (@kentcdodds). The tweet promotes a limited-time offer: buying "Ship Modern Full-Stack Web Applications Pro" (at a 40% discount) includes Pro licenses for "Get Really Good at React." The tweet highlights the value of $2,131 for $720, almost 70% off, and urges followers not to miss the offer. The tweet also includes an image with the text "LEARN THE SMART. EFFICIENT WAY TO TEST ANY JAVASCRIPT APP" and "Your Essential Guide to Flawless Testing" and "UPDATED FOR 2020" and "Testing JavaScript with Kent C. Dodds"

caption.plain_text: Image /page/19/Picture/5 description: This image is a screenshot of a tweet by Kent C. Dodds (@kentcdodds). EFFICIENT WAY TO TEST ANY JAVASCRIPT APP" and "Your Essential Guide to Flawless Testing" and "UPDATED FOR 2020" and "Testing JavaScript with Kent C. Dodds"

text.content: This course will teach you the fundamentals of testing your JavaScript  applications using ESlint, TypeScript, Jest, and Cypress.

cells.plain_text: This course will teach you the fundamentals of testing your JavaScript  applications using ESlint, TypeScript, Jest, and Cypress.

text.content: This course will teach you the fundamentals of testing your JavaScript  applications using ESlint, TypeScript, Jest, and Cypress.

cells.plain_text: This course will teach you the fundamentals of testing your JavaScript  applications using ESlint, TypeScript, Jest, and Cypress.

text.content: This went extremely well! We had a ton of people jump on within the first 24 hours. I spent a lot of time on , discord, and in my email inbox answering people's questions and helping people see the value Epic Web could offer them. Launch days are always fun.

rich_text.plain_text: This went extremely well! We had a ton of people jump on within the first 24 hours. I spent a lot of time on , discord, and in my email inbox answering people's questions and helping people see the value Epic Web could offer them. Launch days are always fun.

text.content: The sale period went on for a few weeks and now the course is full price (with support for purchasing power parity of course). In the last couple weeks, we added support for à la carte purchases of the workshops as well. People are still joining us every day, though the launch period will always be the biggest spike.

rich_text.plain_text: The sale period went on for a few weeks and now the course is full price (with support for purchasing power parity of course). In the last couple weeks, we added support for à la carte purchases of the workshops as well. People are still joining us every day, though the launch period will always be the biggest spike.

text.content: I'm super excited about the future of Epic Web. With Epic React and Testing JavaScript, I created the material, published, and it was done (with small, necessary updates here and there). Epic Web is bigger and certainly not done. I have so much that I still want to teach. Here's some stuff on my list:

rich_text.plain_text: I'm super excited about the future of Epic Web. With Epic React and Testing JavaScript, I created the material, published, and it was done (with small, necessary updates here and there). Epic Web is bigger and certainly not done. I have so much that I still want to teach. Here's some stuff on my list:

text.content: There's so much more. So I was looking at this list of things I wanted to do and I decided that I could either make people wait for me to produce all this stuff, or I could get some other folks to help me.

rich_text.plain_text: There's so much more. So I was looking at this list of things I wanted to do and I decided that I could either make people wait for me to produce all this stuff, or I could get some other folks to help me.

text.content: The trouble is I really like having all the control. I like the consistency that a single instructor and teaching method gives learners. But I thought if I could find some excellent people who would be willing to let me guide them in the way I want things to be taught and the recommendations I want to make, then I could get a lot more done.

rich_text.plain_text: The trouble is I really like having all the control. I like the consistency that a single instructor and teaching method gives learners. But I thought if I could find some excellent people who would be willing to let me guide them in the way I want things to be taught and the recommendations I want to make, then I could get a lot more done.

text.content: So that's what I did! So I reached out to Simon

rich_text.plain_text: So that's what I did! So I reached out to Simon

text.content: and he agreed to contribute to the Epic Web world! He's already started producing free material for Epic Web which you can find on

rich_text.plain_text: and he agreed to contribute to the Epic Web world! He's already started producing free material for Epic Web which you can find on

text.content: I have other folks I'm working with as well, but we haven't announced them yet. Stay tuned for that!

rich_text.plain_text: I have other folks I'm working with as well, but we haven't announced them yet. Stay tuned for that!

text.content: Don't worry, we're going to keep Epic Web consistent and excellent. I'm convinced that a big part of what I offer as an instructor is good opinions and a curated learning path. Other instructional sites are loaded with lots of good, but conflicting recommendations. That's not what you'll find on Epic Web.

rich_text.plain_text: Don't worry, we're going to keep Epic Web consistent and excellent. I'm convinced that a big part of what I offer as an instructor is good opinions and a curated learning path. Other instructional sites are loaded with lots of good, but conflicting recommendations. That's not what you'll find on Epic Web.

text.content: While I appreciate that not every tool is the right one for every job, you'll never be able to cover every edge case and there's a lot of value in having a consistent message and recommendation. And the nuance can be addressed as needed. But Epic Web will give you a proven path to building excellent full stack applications. And we'll do that faster by having more excellent instructors.

rich_text.plain_text: While I appreciate that not every tool is the right one for every job, you'll never be able to cover every edge case and there's a lot of value in having a consistent message and recommendation. And the nuance can be addressed as needed. But Epic Web will give you a proven path to building excellent full stack applications. And we'll do that faster by having more excellent instructors.

text.content: Next year is going to be an awesome year for your education on Epic Web. Stay tuned!

rich_text.plain_text: Next year is going to be an awesome year for your education on Epic Web. Stay tuned!

text.content: Image /page/22/Picture/5 description: This image is a screenshot of a tweet by Kent C. Dodds (@kentcdodds). In the tweet, Kent C. Dodds announces that he has recorded the first 3 videos of what will become Epic React v2. He also mentions that it is coming in a few months. The tweet includes a picture of a graphic with the text "Ship Modern Full-Stack Web Applications" and the URL "www.epicweb.dev". The tweet was posted on November 30th, 2023 at 4:58 PM (UTC).

caption.plain_text: Image /page/22/Picture/5 description: This image is a screenshot of a tweet by Kent C. Dodds (@kentcdodds). In the tweet, Kent C. Dodds announces that he has recorded the first 3 videos of what will become Epic React v2. He also mentions that it is coming in a few months. The tweet includes a picture of a graphic with the text "Ship Modern Full-Stack Web Applications" and the URL "www.epicweb.dev". The tweet was posted on November 30th, 2023 at 4:58 PM (UTC).

text.content: The launch of Epic Web was incredibly difficult. But I'm so glad that I managed it. I'm excited to build on top of this foundation and continue to help people like you in your full stack web development journey. Thanks for coming along!

rich_text.plain_text: The launch of Epic Web was incredibly difficult. But I'm so glad that I managed it. I'm excited to build on top of this foundation and continue to help people like you in your full stack web development journey. Thanks for coming along!

text.content: Kent C. Dodds is a JavaScript software engineer and teacher. Kent's taught hundreds of thousands of people how to make the world a better place with quality software development tools and practices. He lives with his wife and four kids in Utah.

rich_text.plain_text: Kent C. Dodds is a JavaScript software engineer and teacher. Kent's taught hundreds of thousands of people how to make the world a better place with quality software development tools and practices. He lives with his wife and four kids in Utah.
